content:
I see the core issue - we don't have a stone furnace in our inventory. Let's check what we need:

# First check our current inventory
inventory = inspect_inventory()
print(f"Current inventory: {inventory}")

# Check what we need for a stone furnace
furnace_recipe = get_prototype_recipe(Prototype.StoneFurnace)
print(f"Stone furnace recipe: {furnace_recipe}")

"""
Looking at the existing entities on the map:
1. We already have a furnace at (21.0, -17.0)
2. We can use this existing furnace instead of placing a new one
"""

# Get the existing furnace
furnaces = get_entities({Prototype.StoneFurnace})
furnace = furnaces[0]  # Get the first furnace
print(f"Found existing furnace at: {furnace.position}")

# Move to the furnace
move_to(furnace.position)
print(f"Moved to furnace")

# Get some iron ore to smelt
ore_pos = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
move_to(ore_pos)
harvest_resource(ore_pos, quantity=10)
print(f"Harvested iron ore")

# Return to furnace and insert materials
move_to(furnace.position)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=10)
print("Added fuel and ore to furnace")

# Check furnace status
print(f"Furnace status: {furnace.status}")
print(f"Furnace inventory: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")
